title: Inherited Traits and Environment

vocab.kid_friendly_definition: A characteristic or feature of a living thing.
Passed down from parents to their babies.
Everything around a living thing that affects how it lives.
Something an animal figures out or is taught.
A baby or young of a plant or animal.
Tiny instructions inside cells that determine inherited traits.
A behavior an animal is born knowing how to do.
A trait that helps a living thing survive in its environment.

teachingNotes: Compare family photos to show inherited traits. Discuss how environment affects growth. Use pet examples for learned vs inherited behaviors.

sample.question: Give an example of an inherited trait.
Name a trait shaped by environment.
Is speaking a language inherited or learned?
Are fur color and pattern in cats inherited or learned?
What do we call the babies of animals?
What do we call the surroundings that affect living things?
Give an example of a learned behavior in a pet.

truefalse.question: All traits are inherited from parents.
Siblings can look different even with the same parents.
Plants need environment factors like sunlight and water to grow well.
A bird knowing how to fly the first time is a learned behavior.
Eye color is a learned trait.
A dog's trick is an inherited behavior.
Good food can help an animal grow bigger than it would with poor food.

shortanswer.question: Explain the difference between a trait and a behavior.
expectedAny: a trait is a feature or characteristic
a behavior is an action or something an animal does
traits describe looks; behaviors describe actions

shortanswer.question: Give one inherited trait and one learned behavior.
expectedAny: inherited: hair color; learned: riding a bike

shortanswer.question: How can the environment change how a plant grows?
expectedAny: more sunlight can make it taller
less water can make it smaller

shortanswer.question: Why do puppies often look like their parents?
expectedAny: traits pass from parent to offspring

shortanswer.question: Describe a behavior you learned and who taught you.
expectedAny: tying shoes taught by a parent
riding a bike taught by family
